overview: The purpose of this Act is to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1] This program is intended to acknowledge the distinct pathways that lead women into the criminal justice system and address their individualized needs. [1] The Act establishes temporary positions, requires a report, appropriates funds, and sunsets on 6/30/2028. [1]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ (HB727) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] The funds are for equipment; mental health, substance abuse treatment, and other services; and the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The bill builds upon Act 243, Session Laws of Hawaii 2022, which established a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the first circuit. [1] This existing program, known as Mohala Wahine, began accepting participants in January of 2023, with a goal of admitting twenty women each year. [1] The proposed expansion requires the establishment of seven temporary positions, including social worker V, social worker IV, circuit court clerk II, and judicial clerk positions. [1] [1]
agency_impact: The judiciary is tasked with establishing the women's court pilot program within the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1] The judiciary will be responsible for expending the appropriated sums for equipment, services, and the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] [1] The judiciary shall also submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the governor and legislature prior to the regular sessions of 2026, 2027, and 2028. [1]
economic_impact: The pilot program's goal is diverting participants from incarceration, supporting their success in the community, and reducing recidivism. [1] Research reflects that for women, histories of abuse, trauma, poverty, mental illness, substance use disorders, and unhealthy relationships intersect with their entry into criminal behavior. [1] By providing services like trauma and mental health treatment, housing support, and vocational training, the program addresses unique barriers to success after incarceration. [1] [1]
policy_impact: This Act expands upon the policy established by Act 243, Session Laws of Hawaii 2022, which created a women's court pilot program in the first circuit. [1] It establishes a temporary three-year woman's court pilot program within the second, third, and fifth circuits, which is set to be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1] [1] The judiciary's required reports will include recommendations as to whether the pilot program should continue, expand, provide additional services, or be discontinued, informing future policy decisions. [1]
revenue_sources: The bill appropriates funds out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [1] No other revenue sources are mentioned in the provided text. [1]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The Act establishes a three-year pilot program with fiscal implications from its effective date of July 1, 2025, to its repeal date of June 30, 2028. [1] An unspecified sum is appropriated from general revenues for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] These funds are for equipment, mental health, substance abuse treatment, and other services. [1] The appropriation also covers the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] These positions include full-time equivalent social worker V positions, social worker IV positions, circuit court clerk II positions, and judicial clerk positions. [1] While the program runs for three years, appropriations are only specified for the first two years. [1] The judiciary is required to submit reports annually before the 2026, 2027, and 2028 legislative sessions. [1] These reports will include recommendations on whether the program should continue, expand, or be discontinued. [1] The fiscal implications beyond the three-year pilot period will depend on future legislation based on these recommendations. [1]
operating_revenue_impact: The provided text does not indicate any anticipated impact on operating revenues resulting from this measure. [1]
capital_expenditure_impact: The measure appropriates an unspecified amount for equipment for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027. [1] No other capital expenditures are specified in the bill. [1]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: This Act shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1] The judiciary is required to submit a report with recommendations as to whether the women's court pilot program should continue, expand, or be discontinued. [1] Any ongoing fiscal obligations after the pilot program's sunset date are contingent upon future legislative action based on the program's outcomes and the judiciary's recommendations. [1]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: No previous fiscal note was provided in the context.
